Action.Name: KeyLock.Cleanup
Action.Description: Deletes the, initially-extracted DisableKeys.dll file based on the creation path speified by the KeyLock.Activate action.

Action.Name: KeyLock.EnableAllKeys
Action.Description: Enables/Disables all keys(excluding Print Screen[PrtScr] and F10) but not key combinations.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key combination. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key combination. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key combination. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key combination. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key combination. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key combination. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Arg.Name: Key
Arg.Description: The decimal number of the specific key to enable or disable. A list of keys can be found in the AMS Help File under key codes.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the key combination. Typically, keys and keys combinations are enabled by default on most systems.

Action.Name: KeyLock.GetDisabledKeys
Action.Description: Gets a list of all disabled keys.

Arg.Name: Return Type
Arg.Description: The type of desired return. You can choose either table or string. If no keys are disabled then nil or a blank string is returned (depending on your return type choice).

Action.Name: KeyLock.GetError
Action.Description: Returns an error if one occurs.

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsAltEscEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the Alt+Esc key combination is disabled.

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsAllKeysEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not all individual keys are disabled(excluding Print Screen[PrtScr] and F10).

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsAltF4Enabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the Alt+F4 key combination is disabled.

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsAltPrtScrEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the Alt+Print Screen key combination is disabled.

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsAltTabEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the Alt+Tab key combination is disabled.

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsCtrlEscEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the Ctrl+Esc key combination is disabled.

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsKeyEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not a specific key is enabled. Accepts strings and numbers as input.

Arg.Name: Key Code
Arg.Description: The decimal value of the key you want to check. These values can be found in the AMS help file under key codes.

Action.Name: KeyLock.IsPrtScrEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not the Print Screen key is disabled.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns a table or string (user option). If no keys are disabled then a blank string or nil table is returned.

Extended.Name: KeyLock
Extended.Description: Enables the programmer to lock and unlock the user's keys.
Extended.Author: Centauri Soldier / sside
Extended.InstallNotes: Place the "KeyLock" folder in your "AutoPlay Media Studio\Plugins\Actions" folder.
